intro: Lessertia carnosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
